title: Amongst the unknown in the struggle for liberation in S.A.
text:
The sudden upswing of political wishes and objectivity within the ranks of the African National Congress followers, and admirers became a stunt of fortune for the bystanders, during the years of struggle for liberation they had never forsaw as an opportunity to be seized as the direct cause very revolution they were against to.
Once, in the political history of South Africa, and other African states that were still under the tight bondage of the imperialist agenda, now find it difficult to understand that, the new political landscape in South Africa, brought a myriad of individuals that, even the greater majority of freedom fighters in this country find it difficult to attest to the political track record of some other "comrades" who now do not have the basic pity of bringing what has been fought for ages, and had shared some lives for the great cause to be enjoyed by the general victims of Apartheid, and anti apartheid activists.
Some say history repeats itself, when things happen in a similar fashion within different epochs, whilst, for it to repeat itself, important aspects and events that led to enjoying what we term as "freedom" should uncover the whereabouts of many martyrs who went missing during that period of time.
The "Johnny-Come-Late" phenomenon, is proved to be playing a role in delaying concerned South Africans in identifying and shaping the true freedom for the majority of the freedom fighters.... It would be better, for the current dispensation to, at least; "remember those who died" and publicise their contribution to the satisfaction of their families and their comrades. A new set of the "Johnny-Come-Lates" is taking the centre-stage, and daring to loot as much as they can, with a long list of collaborating freedom fighters who are willing to sell their cause for freedom at the expense of efforts and blood of the forgotten...
A list is endless: These comrades, that are not known in the history of revolution in South Africa, should not be accorded a status to contest for the leadership positions in all sector of our society
